index.title: Blue Biotech Hackathon
index.subtitle: Join us in our 40-hour hackathon to innovate and develop cutting-edge solutions in biotechnology, science, and industry.

about.title: Our Philosophy
about.subtitle: takes prides in tackling multifaceted and complex challenges of today's world, recognizing that solutions require diverse perspectives and collaborative efforts. We believe that everyone has valuable insights that can contribute to the advancement of humanity. Our focus is on science, knowledge transfer, software development, sustainability, and innovation.

partners.title: Partners
partners.subtitle: Our partners drive innovation and excellence, providing vital support and resources to advance marine science and technology solutions.

necton.name: Necton
necton.description: Necton’s mission is to bring to market innovative products and services resulting from scientific and technological marine knowledge.

ccdr.name: CCDR Algarve
ccdr.description: CCDR Algarve facilitates the implementation of environmental policies, territorial and urban planning, regional development, and incentives for social communication within its geographical area, while also providing technical support to local authorities and their associations.

ccmar.name: CCMAR Algarve
ccmar.description: Non-profit organization located on the Gambelas campus of the University of Algarve and dedicated to R&D in the Marine Sciences.

inductiva.name: Inductiva.AI
inductiva.description: Inductiva API helps you take physical simulations to the next level. Use Python to easily run the open-source simulators you love, on the cloud, at scale.

apa.name: Agência Portuguesa do Ambiente
apa.description: Agência Portuguesa do Ambiente is responsible for implementing environmental policies in Portugal. APA aims to contribute to a high level of protection and enhancement of the environment through the provision of quality services to citizens.

ipma.name: Instituto Português do Mar e da Atmosfera
ipma.description: The Instituto Português do Mar e da Atmosfera is the national meteorological, seismic, sea and atmospheric organization of Portugal.

albufeira.name: Câmara Municipal de Albufeira
albufeira.description: Albufeira provides precious access to the Sala Azul as our hackathon venue.

blue-cloud.name: Blue-Cloud 2026
blue-cloud.description: Building on existing infrastructures like Copernicus and EMODnet, Blue-Cloud aims to create a federated ecosystem for FAIR and open data in marine research. Through a web-based platform, it offers simplified access to multidisciplinary datasets, analytical services, and computing facilities.

cria.name: CRIA
cria.description: Division of Entrepreneurship and Technology Transfer of the University of Algarve.

green-colab.name: GreenColab
green-colab.description: Joining the Pieces in Algal Biotechnology. A collaborative platform to bridge the transfer of knowledge from academia, industry, stakeholders, and consumers.

tech-hub.name: Algarve Tech Hub
tech-hub.description: Developing a robust ecosystem in the area of new technologies, attracting international stakeholders, technological talent, investors and digital nomads to the Algarve..

local-foundation.name: local.foundation
local-foundation.description: Providing right tools and mindset to work together on building better communities.

geeksessions.name: Geek Sessions
geeksessions.description: Fostering knowledge exchange and collaboration within the Digital Product community of the Algarve (and beyond!).

gdg.name: GDG Faro
gdg.description: Google Developer Group Faro is a community of developers, which organizes events for developers.

econ.name: UAlg Economics Faculty
econ.description: FEUALG's accumulated knowledge of socio-economic reality, coupled with the strong links it holds with the business community and public administration, ensure that the Faculty of Economics seeks to adapt university education to the labour market, and its research to the technical-scientific needs of today's society.

tc.name: Teresa Correia
tc.position: Scientist at CCMAR, medical imaging and AI

challenges.title: Challenges
challenges.subtitle: Our challenges are suggestions from our partners, which can also help mentoring you. Feel free to propose your own challenges or spin out of our samples. They are designed to address real-world problems in marine science and technology.

challenge1.title: Groundwater Challenge by Luis Costa (APA)
challenge1.description: Algarve region in south Portugal is experiencing a multi-year drought of 10 years. Agência Portuguesa do Ambiente (APA) in Faro is responsible for monitoring groundwater level (quantity status) and quality (Chemical status) in its 25 separate groundwater bodies, which correspond to 17 main aquifers. The monitoring of the groundwater levels is usually performed with a monthly frequency in around 150 observation points (wells) spread around the groundwater bodies. THe figure shows that during the month of September 2023, groundwater levels reached negative values compared to mean-sea-level, thus, increasing the risk of sea water intrusion, which could have unprecedented consequences for the citizens, businesses and the region as a whole.

challenge2.title: Microalgae Genetics Challenge by CCMAR/GreenColab/Necton
challenge2.description: Algae are responsible for around 50% of earth's photosynthetic output, mostly occurring underwater. There are estimated 72 000 algal species. They can be unicellular but also 50 m in length (kelps). The light-harvesting makes them 'power plants' and 'production plants' at the same time. It is used for treating waste water, producing energy, food, fertilizers, pharmaceutical and cosmetic high-value compounds etc. Representing academia, tech transfer platform and industry, you can explore the ocean of microalgae tech with Biomartech group at CCMAR, GreenColab and Necton. Suggested challenges tackle the vast databases and methods for algal genomics. You can integrate data source, identify new genes with deep-learning models and drive new discoveries and innovations in compound production.

challenge3.title: Fisheries Monitoring Challenge by Rui Coelho (IPMA)
challenge3.description: This challenge provides and opportunity to work in fisheries, especially related with large migratory species that Rui Coelho is an expert. The main objectives would be to collate various datasets on catch-and-effort, that could then be used to track species abundance and status of the fishing stocks. A final objective would be to develop a visualization tool that is informative not only for scientists, but also managers and the general public.

challenge4.title: AI for smart agriculture by Dário Passos (CEOT)
challenge4.description: Traditionally,  thousands of fruits are manually sampled and analyzed post-harvest to provide insight into the fruit maturation and quality. These analytical laboratory destructive tests aim at quantifying internal quality parameters such as sugar content, dry matter content, etc. Alternatively, near-infrared spectroscopy provides a non-destructive way of getting the same information by analysing the interaction of light with the fruit. The chemical composition of the fruit translates into specific light patterns (spectra) that, with the help of chemometrics models, can be mapped back to internal quality parameters. Nowadays machine-learning/deep-learning models are being explored as tools to create these chemometric models promising new avenues of applications. Dário Passos is an expert in designing such models. These models for spectral data analysis, are also applicable in medicine, biotechnology and other areas. This is a perfect opportunity to explore machine learning techniques (e.g. DL) aimed at this new data modality (1d spectra). Come and participate into this challenge to find good methodologies to use this type of data for predictions of fruit quality.

challenge5.title: Open challenge using Inductiva.AI simulators
challenge5.description: High-performance simulations drive progress in engineering, environmental science, and many other fields. Inductiva.AI provides a platform for running simulations at scale, using Python. This challenge invites you to explore the possibilities of Inductiva.AI simulators under mentoring of Inductiva engineer Luís Cunha, and to develop new tools and workflows. The only limit is your imagination!

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: have the opportunity to present their challenges, mentor participating teams, and advertise their brand. To become a sponsor and help us deliver an exceptional hackathon focused on sustainable blue economy development and technological advancement, please contact us at

day1.name: Oct 18, free entry
day1.description: Get to know fellow participants, tools and mentors. Brainstorm and form teams.

items.event: Introduction to the Hackathon and Blue-Cloud
How to get from research data to a product
Necton, >25 years in the microalgae world
Improving bioinformatics tools for microalgae challenge

day2.name: Oct 19, catering is on us
day2.description: Hard working day with help of mentors and food breaks. Teams decide their schedule.

day3.name: Oct 20
day3.description: Finalize your product for submission. Move to the after party where demos will be presented, prizes announced, decompression offered.

event-info.title: Event Info
event-info.teams: 2-4 members (+1 remote) for tackling any challenge related to biotechnology and scientific, or industry solution for blue economy. See
event-info.why: To collaborate, learn, and create impactful solutions.
scope_list: Biotechnology: Innovations in marine biology, sustainable fisheries, bioprospecting or marine conservation.
Science: Data-driven solutions for marine science, environmental monitoring or marine industry.
Industry: Novel business models that support sustainable use of ocean resources, eco-friendly maritime industries, or blue economy startups.
event-info.p1p3: on marine science, data, software tools and ideation.
event-info.p3p3: while introducing you to local stakeholders and their challenges.

rules: Teams have a minimum of 2 and maximum of 4 members. Every team can have 1 extra external member participating remotely.
Teams will be formed (mostly) on Friday, Oct 18 after the brainstorming session.
Team members can not participate on different teams.
Teams should start the event without having any previous development work done.
Even though the competition officially starts on Friday, Oct 18, final deadline to register a team and its name is 9 a.m. Saturday, Oct 19, delivered on paper.

ideas.title: Selecting an idea
list: Any idea you might choose to explore during the hackathon is valid if that idea, prototype (functional or not), project is within the scope of Blue Economy and/or Biotechnology.
A set of challenges by sponsors and CCMAR will be compiled and presented publicly before the Friday, Oct 18.
list2: Mentors with different expertise will be available for the teams to request help and consultation.
Debugging sessions will be scheduled, where the teams can share their issues and get input from other teams.
Delivery deadline is expected around 13:00, Sunday, Oct 20.

jury.title: Judging
jury.subtitle: Scores on scale from 0 to 10, with 10 being the highest score. Projects will be judged by a panel of experts on the following criteria:
list: Impact: Determine the practical applicability of the project and its potential impact on society, and the environment.
Feasibility: Consider the project's execution and whether it can realistically be brought to market or implemented in a real-world setting.
Originality: Assess the originality of the idea and the creativity in its application. Consider how the project stands out from existing solutions and its potential to introduce new paradigms.
Rigor: Evaluate the scientific basis of the project, including the accuracy of the data, the soundness of the methodology, and the validity of the conclusions.
jury.subtitle2: Code Blue Hackathon is dedicated to providing a safe and comfortable environment for all participants. Please refer to the
jurylist: Deborah Power: Professor at CCMAR, leader of Comparative Endocrinology group
Maria Lurdes Carvalho: CCDR Algarve, Head of Department of Regional Development

Dário Passos: CEOT (UAlg), Researcher in machine learning and AI
